{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2977190,"name":"pribusin","username":"pribusin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pribusin/{size}/4044_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-16T23:21:48.055Z","cooked":"

We have some of the old Digilent DMC 60c motor controllers that we want to use for an off-season project together with a roboRIO. We‚Äôre struggling to get them to connect to the RIO and to be able to configure them so that we can assign CAN IDs. Any help is appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-11-16T23:21:48.055Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":75,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":409.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":397384,"topic_slug":"digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems","display_username":"pribusin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11687,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4004 M.A.R.S. Rovers"},"post_url":"/t/digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems/397384/1","custom_user_title":"4004 M.A.R.S. Rovers","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2977195,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-17T00:16:32.409Z","cooked":"

The DMC60C motor controller is still listed as legal in the 2021 FRC game manual, but the vendordep hasn‚Äôt been updated since 2019. It won‚Äôt work with WPILib 2020 or later due to ABI incompatibility. There were also breaking changes in the CAN stack in 2020. You won‚Äôt be able to compile the vendordep yourself against a newer roboRIO image because Digilent never provided source code at https://github.com/Digilent/dmc60c-frc-api. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôll be possible to get the DMC60C working with CAN.

By the way, production and support for the DMC60C stopped after the CTRE v. Digilent lawsuit. Basically, Digilent reverse engineered and copied CTRE‚Äôs hardware to make a competing product that can run CTRE‚Äôs firmware. CTRE sued for breach of their license agreement.

calcmogul:

Basically, Digilent reverse engineered and copied CTRE‚Äôs hardware to make a competing product that can run CTRE‚Äôs firmware. CTRE sued for breach of their license agreement.

If they did a good job, maybe you can try flashing the CTRE firmware
/S

Control over PWM is probably the most (only?) viable path fwd for the DMC60C.

DMC60C motor controller is still listed as legal

One of the worst things FIRST has ever done.

Even adding the SD540 in the first place is objectively worse from a safety standpoint, but yeah‚Ä¶the whole situation is a big for FIRST and NI.

ofc the SD540 is also PWM only now for similar reasons.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-11-17T03:50:19.702Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":397384,"topic_slug":"digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4999,"username":"Nate_Laverdure","name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"‚ù§Ô∏è conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems/397384/5","custom_user_title":"‚ù§Ô∏è conflict-free COTS","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2977241,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-17T04:16:20.572Z","cooked":"
Nate_Laverdure:

One of the worst things FIRST has ever done.

Given that teams bought them and FIRST generally leaves motor controllers legal (if occasionally with clipped wings as with the Jaguar going PWM-only), I have a hard time finding a way out that doesn‚Äôt leave teams holding the bag. At the minimum, a sunset date would be appropriate.

That said: 9 DMC60s appeared in the 2020 usage data. 356 Talons and 10 Jaguars appear in the same data; both have been out of production motor controllers for significantly longer. (For comparison: 7,928 Talon SRXs, 5,432 SPARK MAXes, 3,491 Talon FXs.)

With the lack of updates forcing them to PWM, I think it‚Äôs a self-solving problem.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-11-17T04:24:35.553Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":53.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":397384,"topic_slug":"digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.firstinspires.org/robotics/frc/blog/2021-beta-testing-usage-report","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2021 Beta Testing and 2020 Data Usage Reporting | FIRST","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems/397384/6","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2977246,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-17T04:42:03.767Z","cooked":"

I don‚Äôt believe the comment was from a support standpoint, but rather a criticism of FIRST‚Äôs non-response to the DMC-60C suit that indirectly left them picking a side, and may have ended up having other consequences for teams down the road as a result.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-11-17T04:42:03.767Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":397384,"topic_slug":"digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems","display_username":"bobbysq","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28014,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems/397384/7","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2977284,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-17T11:36:46.951Z","cooked":"

Sorry I wasn‚Äôt clear. Certifying the device in the first place was the mistake.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-11-17T11:36:46.951Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":120.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":397384,"topic_slug":"digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems","display_username":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":4999,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cynicism isn't wisdom"},"post_url":"/t/digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems/397384/8","custom_user_title":"Cynicism isn't wisdom","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2977285,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-17T11:41:19.298Z","cooked":"

What was the correct public response? FIRST wasn‚Äôt a party to the lawsuit, the lawsuit has been ongoing until summer of 2020, and at that point FIRST was in a place of ‚Äúmake teams do as little as possible to participate in 2021‚Äù which limited the response options further.

Sure, they could yank it from the legal controller list and that would be a response now that the lawsuit is settled. But it would leave the teams holding the bag and wouldn‚Äôt harm Digilent who has already clearly abandoned the product.

And what kind of public statement does a non-party to the lawsuit make that doesn‚Äôt end up kicking dirt on one of the two? CTRE has its win, let nature take its course here.

Nate_Laverdure:

Sorry I wasn‚Äôt clear. Certifying the device in the first place was the mistake.

I‚Äôll agree, someone should‚Äôve noticed the stench on this controller; it was obvious from the moment I first laid eyes on it. But once legalized, teams should expect it to stay that way for a reasonable length of time. (And Jaguar support has set a standard for that length of time.)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-11-17T11:41:19.298Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":30.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":397384,"topic_slug":"digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28014,"username":"bobbysq","name":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems/397384/9","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2977326,"name":"Clayton Yocom","username":"Clayton_Yocom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clayton_yocom/{size}/194737_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-17T15:31:25.414Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôd be extremely hard to imagine that FIRST did not have some inkling of what their strategic partner was doing when making these controllers.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-11-17T15:31:25.414Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":397384,"topic_slug":"digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems","display_username":"Clayton Yocom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15041,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Slava Ukraini üá∫üá¶"},"post_url":"/t/digilent-dmc-60c-motor-driver-can-id-configuration-problems/397384/10","custom_user_title":"Slava Ukraini üá∫üá¶","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2977346,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-17T17:06:43.232Z","cooked":"
Clayton_Yocom:

I‚Äôd be extremely hard to imagine that FIRST did not have some inkling of what their strategic partner was doing

NI is FIRST‚Äôs strategic partner, not Digilent. NI acquired Digilent, but not all parent companies micromanage their subsidiaries. We don‚Äôt know how much of a hand NI had in Digilent‚Äôs decisions, so we shouldn‚Äôt speculate. I‚Äôm not saying NI should or shouldn‚Äôt have been aware; there‚Äôs just not enough context here.
